wikipedia_page.main:
Robert Cameron (1825 – 13 February 1913) was a Liberal Party politician in the United Kingdom.
Before he took office, he was a schoolmaster.At the 1895 general election, he was elected as Member of Parliament (MP) for Houghton-le-Spring in County Durham, and held the seat until he died in office in 1913, at age 87.

response: * Robert Cameron (British politician) (1825–1913), Liberal Member of Parliament for Houghton-le-Spring, 1895–1913
* Robert Cameron (New South Wales politician) (1890–1970), New South Wales politician
* Robert Cameron (Queen's Park footballer) (fl. 1909–1911), Scottish footballer
* Robert Cameron (Lincoln City footballer) (fl. 1892–1893), Scottish footballer
